title: Combining conditions: and/or/not, parentheses, and readable checks
content:
As programs grow, you often combine several checks in one decision. The goal is to keep conditions readable.

---
## 1) Basic and/or/not

```python
logged_in = True
is_admin = False

if logged_in and is_admin:
    print("admin panel")
else:
    print("regular view")
```

```python
role = "editor"

if role == "admin" or role == "editor":
    print("can edit")
else:
    print("read only")
```

```python
name = ""
if not name:
    print("name required")
```

---
## 2) Parentheses for clarity

```python
age = 19
has_ticket = True
vip = False

if (age >= 18 and has_ticket) or vip:
    print("enter")
else:
    print("no entry")
```

---
## 3) A slightly larger example: validate a password

```python
pwd = "Abc123"

has_len = len(pwd) >= 6
has_digit = any(ch.isdigit() for ch in pwd)
has_upper = any(ch.isupper() for ch in pwd)

if has_len and has_digit and has_upper:
    print("strong enough")
else:
    print("try again")
```
